UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cationic Intrinsically Disordered Antimicrobial Peptides (CIDAMPs) Represent a New Paradigm of Innate Defense with a Potential for Novel Anti-Infectives.
Literature.Author: Latendorf T, Gerstel U, Wu Z, Bartels J, Becker A, Tholey A, Schröder JM

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human embryonic kidney HEK293 cells:50% Cytotoxicity=>32 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538(LC90=0.3µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 6538(LC=9.38µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=>32µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=>32µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=>32µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=>32µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 43300(MIC=>32µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 90028(MIC=>32µg/ml),Cryptococcus neoformans ATCC 208821(MIC=4µg/ml)
